alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 9:42PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall over portions of west central St. Bernard and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 1030 PM CDT... At 940 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shell Beach to near Belle Chasse. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy Rain and occasional to frequent lightning SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain could lead to ponding in some low lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Belle Chasse, Shell Beach, Poydras and Violet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Occasional to frequent lightning is also occurring with these storms. If you are outdoors, seek shelter inside.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard
